Articles.Content: So here I am, launching a Tomahawk-analogue from the KSC. I put together my rocket (MechJeb capsule, 4 Control Surfaces, 4 forward-swept CS, 3 stock small tanks and an Aerospike) and launch it in the general direction of "North". I level out the trim at 6000 meters and shut off the engine, wondering how far I'll get before it crashes and explodes magnificently... and I come back two hours later and it's still flying north, fuel long since spent.
It's the infinite glide bug. It's been around for a few versions.

Its not really much of a bug. Its mostly because the wings that are in the game are hacks of the winglet code. There was a version of C7 Flight Pack in the works that was all new code, but it was a plugin and has yet to be recoded or put in the game (for one reason or another).
After a total of 5 hours flight time and circling the planet twice.... yeah, no, I flipped it inverted and blew up a mountain.
